Question refers to the following images.

content.question:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

The images show an overview of the exterior and a detail of the tympanum of the Church of Sainte-Foy, built in Conques, France, c. 1050–1130 C.E.

Describe the specific function of the Church of Sainte-Foy.

Describe at least one visual characteristic of the Church of Sainte-Foy.

Using specific contextual evidence, explain how the function influenced both the design and the sculptural program of the Church of Sainte-Foy.

Using specific evidence, explain why the sculptural program of the Church of Sainte-Foy is important for understanding the significance of the site for its original audience.

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe contextual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. function.  b. context.  c. siting or physical context.  d. subject matter.  e. reception.
